text: Hemmings!  Sam, I thought I told you to  close up shop and be ready to move up the  island by night-...
Yes, Captain Brynner, you did, but-but--
...what, Sam?  Can't I go down to the  loading dock for a few hours without  coming back to find a major...
Uh, with all due respect, sir, Dr. Long  told me to prep the field for detonation  at...
Jesus Chri--  We're on a very slippery  slope here, Sam.  A covert military  operation riddled with civilian...
You don't think it's that bad, do you,  sir?  I mean, Long's spent the last two  years developing his defoliant.  The  stuff can't even kill crabgrass yet.
...out here, captain.  Don't you think  the guys deserve a break?
We're not gonna take chances on our last  day.
I thought we wrapped the tests yes-...
...gonna shit if he finds out we haven't  closed up...

I had something of an epiphany this  morning, Telstar.  I eliminated the  binary shell and I grafted the cobalt ion  to the other side of the molecule.  I  think it might give us a significantly  more rapid chemical ignition.
Well, (clears throat) Costello's finished  with the stability profile, but Abbott is  still chewing on the load file.
So reaction temperature is fifty degrees.
Well, your prediction was on the nose.
How much longer for the range and power  projections?
(sighs) (raspberries) I don't know.  Um,  he's working, but there's a lot of data.   Maybe...another hour?
We don't have an hour.  We're already  supposed to be shut down.
What the hell is all this about a  detonation today?  We're scheduled...
I don't work for you, Captain Brynner.
Sweeney tells me you don't have computer  confirmation?
You know, captain, if you hadn't spent so  much of your career questioning your  superiors, you might've found yourself  with more gold leaf on your col-...
This isn't some kind of pissing contest,  Long.  You may be in charge here, but  those men out there are my responsi-...
Look, this is a scientific experiment,  okay?
If it works, your stock at the Pentagon  will go up along with mine.  I don't  think I need to mention you could use the  help.
The NSA thinks the UN is onto your  work...
...here, and the White House is screaming  about chemical weapons, (face off) and  we're...
...sittin' here with our hands in the  goddamn cookie jar!  And let me tell you  something else.  I didn't join the  service to let people like you turn...
...the United States into the kind of  country we're supposed to be fighting  against.
(overlapping) But you have no choice but  to follow orders.
Now, I know.  You have moral objections  to what we're doing here, but believe...
...me, if I thought there was any real  danger, I-I wouldn't go forward.
You have my word on that.
(sighs) (whispering) All right. (in  normal voice) One more shot, provided...  (sighs) we're off the island tonight.
Ladies and gentlemen...Elvis is  approaching the stage.
And make sure Hemmings hears you say it.

(voice over) It is the opinion of this  review panel...
(voice over) ...that the verdict  delivered in this case is justified, and  that you are in fact...

I assume your silence indicates assent.   Transfer to Leavenworth will be  immediate.  You're dismissed.
...I wish they would've let me say  something...

(interrupting) There's nothing to say,  doctor.  Someone had to take the fall,  and they still need you, whereas...I've  never been anything more than a thorn in  their collective side, as you once said.
So I'll be locked safely away in some  hole along with my secret sins.  And  yours.
Been trying to figure out your secret.
Yeah.  Ten months we've been fishin' this  river together.  We use the same  equipment, more or less...
(off) ...but you pull twice as many fish  out of the water as I do.
And I'm good at this.  Been doing it  since I was a kid.  But you, I don't  know.  Somehow you think...

(face off) How can we ever hope to win  against the trout?
There's only one way you can do it,  Mason.
(off) Turn the power of the hunter  against him.
(off) ...create a piece of bait that  sends the fish's instincts into  overdrive...
...forcing him to strike.  And only then  does our noble friend realize that the  prey...can bite...

But I don't think you would.
(off) ...-son.  Of all the days for you  to show up late. (sighs) First, the idiot  April calls in sick.  Then I got a bad  tooth...

Oh.  Well, I have got to get to the  dentist be-...
...-fore he closes, which means you're  gonna have to cover the grill and the  floor.
Mm.  It doesn't take a genius.
(sighs) Oh, caught a few, lost a few.
(chuckles) Story of my life. (sighing)  Well, one thing you won't lose is that  friend of yours back there, I'll tell you  that.
Oh, you're two of a kind, doc.  Oh, he  may not have your sheepskins, and...
(off) ...well, most of the time he looks  like something the cat might have dragged  in, but, you know...
Uh, we both like to fish.
His I know.  Yours I don't have a clue.  (grunts) But if it wasn't for you, I  think he'd have drifted right on through  this town.
You know, I have yet to get a simple cup  of coffee and a meal in this place,  Darlene.
And you ain't gonna start now.
And don't give him any ice cream...

(off) (overlapping) ...ready before the  morning crowd blows in.  I got it...

Is that why you're here?  To blame...
(off) ...me?  Well, you could've saved  yourself the trip.
I know where the (chuckling) blame  belongs.  But I didn't put you in prison,  Andrew.  The government did...
Oh, I'm well aware of what the government  did, I assure you.  Actually, I've just  come to say how grateful I am to you...
Together, you gave me the opportunity to  realize just how very wrong my life had  gone.
(off) Do you remember telling me once  that all through my career, I'd never fit  in?  Well...
...you were right, of course.  But  after...
(off) ...years of thinking the matter  over, I began to see that the whole thing  wasn't really my problem.
What rational man could fit in with the  sorts of things our government was doing?   The sorts of things you've...
Do you think I haven't seen the bodies of  those...
(off) ...men every time I've closed my  eyes?  But after you went away, I--

All right.  After they put you away...
...I began trying to find ways of  controlling the effects of the weapon  that we tested on Horn Island.
And let me guess.  You failed.
Why is it you scientists can create  implements of destruction...

It's not such a bad place.  I should  know, after all.
Morning, doc.  Awful early, aren't ya?
Couldn't sleep, Pumper.  Is everything,  uh, all right tonight?
There's nothin' goin' on out there,  doc...except maybe the occasional fly  fisherman.
Colonel Brynner.  I've got an appointment  to see Doc-...
Can I see some I.D., sir?
(over speaker) (raps under following  scene and dialogue)
What, do you work for my boss, dog?

Sam?  Andy gave Sam a nice big desk to  park his fat ass behind.

Morning, Mason.  Two large coffees to go,  okay?
So, Mason, last Wednesday night,  uh...were you out...

If it was Wednesday night, I was workin'.
(face off) Do you recognize this young  man?
